page.title: 11Service Provision.
page.content: Marchants bus company (owned and run by Roy Marchant; mayor of Cheltenham 1983) offers a much cheaper service than the National bus company. Marchants buses are always full; standing room only on saturdays! Public transport does, however, create problems for the young and for those who are not car owners. Stoke Orchard is only served by the more expensive National bus company and the last Marchants bus from Cheltenham leaves at 10.15 p.m. This is considered too early for those who wish to visit a cinema, a theatre, or a local discotheque. Although the main line railway from Bristol to Birmingham runs through the area, there are no railway stations. The nearest railway station is in Cheltenham.
